page.title: 12Balmoral Curling Club
page.content: At the beginning of winter the curling pond is filled with water so that it can freeze over (weather permitting). The ice is marked out for the games . The game is played by throwing granite stones, called curling stones, along the ice towards a target. Often other teams come from Tarland, Braemar etc. Mrs Morrison makes soup for the players and return matches are arranged. The club has 24 members this year and it costs Â£1.50 to join. There are many trophies to be won. Some of them date back to the reign of King Edward 7th. Rose bowl, small King cup, large King cup, Tantalis trophy, Caladonian medal, are joined this year by two new trophies the Invercauld trophy and the Hydrasun trophy.
